data.title: International
data.text:
Berlin Film Festival Unveils Competition Jury

The Berlin International Film Festival on Tuesday unveiled the competition jury for its 2019 edition, with German actress Sandra Huller ('Toni Erdmann'), Oscar-winning Chilean director Sebastian Lelio and British helmer Trudie Styler joining jury president Juliette Binoche to pick the winners of this year's Gold and Silver Bears.

Movie News

By

Japanese Box Office Tops $2B, Hits Third-Highest Total in 2018

The Japanese box office in 2018 was down just under 3 percent to $2.04 billion (?223 billion) but still registered the third-highest annual total of all time, with admissions falling by a similar percentage to 169.2 million.

General News

By

Sundance: Netflix Picks Up Richie Mehta’s ‘Delhi Crime’ Series

Netflix has picked up 'Delhi Crime,' a seven-part series written and directed by Indo-Canadian filmmaker Richie Mehta and inspired by the real-life police investigation into the horrific and fatal gang rape of a young woman in Delhi, which caused national outrage in December 2012.

TV News

By

Dusan Makavejev, Yugoslavian Director of ‘Montenegro,’ Dies at 86

Dusan Makavejev, the Yugoslavian writer, director and vanguard of creative cinema known for his offbeat vision and erotic work in the 1960s and '70s, died Friday in the Serbian capital of Belgrade, according to local reports. He was 86.

Movie News

By

Actresses on Hollywood Shoots in Canada Are Underpaid, Census Finds

On Monday ACTRA, the Canadian actors union, released the findings of an industry census that indicated Canadian actresses make 25 percent less on average than their male counterparts in Ontario, the country's biggest media market.

General News

By

Sundance: Lupita Nyong’o Zombie Comedy ‘Little Monsters’ Goes to Neon, Hulu

After its Midnight section premiere, zombie comedy 'Little Monsters' has been picked up by Neon and Hulu in a partnership.

General News

By

French Police Investigate Theft of Banksy Art at Bataclan

A French judicial official says police are investigating the theft of an artwork by the British artist Banksy that was painted as a tribute to the victims of the 2015 terror attacks at the Bataclan music hall in Paris.

Lifestyle News

By

‘Avatar’ Star Sam Worthington Joins ‘Seacole’ Cast (Exclusive)

'Avatar' star Sam Worthington has signed up for 'Seacole,' joining 'Belle' actress Gugu Mbatha-Rawa in the period drama from 'In Secret' director Charlie Stratton about 19th century Jamaican physician Mary Seacole.

Movie News

By

Blood, Faith and Eel Fishing in Drama ‘The Miracle of the Sargasso Sea’ (Exclusive Berlin Trailer)

The first trailer to 'The Miracle of the Sargasso Sea,' the new drama from Greek director Syllas Tzoumerkas, has dropped, whetting auteur appetites ahead of the film's world premiere at the Berlin film festival next month.

Movie News

By

ZDF Enterprises Buys 49 Percent Stake in Producer of Berlin Film Festival Opener

German production and sales group ZDF Enterprises has acquired a 49 percent stake in TV and film producer Nadcon Film, best known for 'The Bridge,' 'The Killing,' Stieg Larsson’s 'Millennium' trilogy and Berlin Film Festival opener 'The Kindness of Strangers,' from German mini-major Constantin Film.

Business News

By

Beta Film, Deutsche Telekom Launch European Series Partnership

German producer and sales group Beta Film has signed a long-term deal with cable giant Deutsche Telekom to supply high-end European series to Telekom's German streaming service Magenta TV.

Business News

By

HBO Europe Greenlights Swedish Drama ‘Beartown’

HBO Europe has greenlit a Swedish-language series adaptation of Beartown, the best-selling novel by Fredrik Backman, author of 'A Man Called Ove.'

TV News

By

Inside ‘State of the Union,’ Nick Hornby’s 10-Minute Sitcom Starring Rosamund Pike, Chris O’Dowd

Directed by Stephen Frears, SundanceTV's unconventional comedy is set in the 10 minutes before a weekly marriage counseling session, and is having its world premiere at the Sundance Film Festival.

General News

By

Viacom’s ‘To Catch a Thief’ TV Remake Casts Alexandra Jimenez, Pablo Echarri (Exclusive)

Viacom’s Spanish-language remake of 'To Catch a Thief' ('Atrapa a un Ladron') has caught its lead cast, signing up two top talents from Spain and Argentina.

Business News

By

China’s Bona Film Group to Co-Finance Tarantino’s ‘Once Upon a Time in Hollywood’ (Exclusive)

Quentin Tarantino's much anticipated Charles Manson movie 'Once Upon a Time in Hollywood,' co-starring Leonardo DiCaprio and Brad Pitt, is getting a major chunk of its financial backing from China. Beijing-based studio Bona Film Group has stepped in as a co-financier of the film with Colombia Pictures.

By
